TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TrackBar extends System.Windows.Forms.Control implements class System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize

Docs.summary: Represents a standard Windows track bar.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The TrackBar is a scrollable control similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ScrollBar> control. You can configure ranges through which the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property of a track bar scrolls by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum%2A> property to specify the lower end of the range and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A> property to specify the upper end of the range.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.LargeChange%2A> property defines the increment to add or subtract from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property when clicks occur on either side of the scroll box. The track bar can be displayed horizontally or vertically.
You can use this control to input numeric data obtained through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property. You can display this numeric data in a control or use it in code.
## Examples The following code example displays a form containing a TrackBar control and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control. The example demonstrates setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.TickFrequency%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.LargeChange%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.SmallChange%2A> properties and handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> contents are updated to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property value when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event occurs.
[!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.t_36_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.windows.forms.t_36_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.t_36_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> is created with a default horizontal orientation and a range of 0 to 10, with a tick mark shown for every value.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool AutoSize { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the height or width of the track bar is being automatically sized.
Docs.value: if the track bar is being automatically sized; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can set the AutoSize property to `true` to cause the track bar to adjust its height (if horizontally aligned) or width (if vertically aligned). The height or width is adjusted to a standard size based on the screen resolution on which the track bar is displayed. Set the AutoSize property to `false` if you want to adjust the size yourself.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.AutoSize%2A> property changes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the AutoSizeChanged event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A?displayProperty=fullName> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> named `TrackBar1`. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the AutoSizeChanged event.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#620](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/e-system.windows.forms.t_14_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#620](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/e-system.windows.forms.t_14_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void BeginInit() cil managed

Docs.summary: Begins the initialization of a that is used on a form or used by another component. The initialization occurs at run time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The [!INCLUDE[vsprvs](~/add/includes/vsprvs-md.md)] design environment uses this method to start the initialization of a component that is used on a form or used by another component. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.EndInit%2A> method ends the initialization. Using BeginInit and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.EndInit%2A> methods prevents the control from being used before it is fully initialized.

Docs.summary: Determines whether the specified key is a regular input key or a special key that requires preprocessing.
Docs.returns: if the specified key is a regular input key; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value to be added to or subtracted from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property when the scroll box is moved a large distance.
Docs.value: A numeric value. The default is 5.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the user presses the PAGE UP or PAGE DOWN key or clicks the track bar on either side of the scroll box, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property changes according to the value set in the LargeChange property. You might consider setting the LargeChange value to a percentage of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Height%2A> (for a vertically oriented track bar) or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Width%2A> (for a horizontally oriented track bar) value. This keeps the distance your track bar moves proportionate to its size.
## Examples The following code example displays a form containing a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> control and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control. The example demonstrates setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.TickFrequency%2A>, LargeChange, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.SmallChange%2A> properties and handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> contents are updated to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property value when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event occurs.
[!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.t_201_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.windows.forms.t_201_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.t_201_1.cs)]

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> contents are updated to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property value when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event occurs.

Docs.value: The minimum value for the . The default is 0.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.SetRange%2A> method to set both the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A> and Minimum properties at the same time.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.TickFrequency%2A>, Minimum, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A> members and how to handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.ValueChanged> event. To run the example, paste the following code into a form that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> control named `TrackBar1` and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control named `TextBox1`. Call the `InitializeTrackBar` method from the form's constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event-handling method.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.t_193_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.windows.forms.t_193_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.t_193_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnRightToLeftLayoutChanged(class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Raises the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnRightToLeftLayoutChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnScroll(class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Raises the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the OnScroll event to update other controls as the position of the scroll box changes.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnScroll method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The control will redraw when the system colors change.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The OnSystemColorsChanged method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

Docs.summary: Raises the event.
Gets or sets a value indicating the horizontal or vertical orientation of the track bar.
Docs.value: One of the values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the Orientation property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Orientation?displayProperty=fullName>, the scroll box moves from left to right as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> increases. When the Orientation property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Orientation?displayProperty=fullName>, the scroll box moves from bottom to top as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> increases.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to set some of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> properties.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The RightToLeftLayout property is used with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.RightToLeft%2A> property for international applications where the language is written from right to left, such as Hebrew or Arabic.

Docs.summary: Occurs when either a mouse or keyboard action moves the scroll box.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example shows how to implement the Scroll event to modify information labels on a form, based on the scrolling of the scroll box on a track bar. The example requires a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form> with three track bars and three labels placed on it.
[!code-cs[TrackBar#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/e-system.windows.forms.t_64_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[TrackBar#3](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/e-system.windows.forms.t_64_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[TrackBar#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/e-system.windows.forms.t_64_1.vb)]
The following code example displays a form that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> control and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control. The example demonstrates setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.TickFrequency%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.LargeChange%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.SmallChange%2A> properties and handling the Scroll event. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> contents are updated to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property value when the Scroll event occurs.
[!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/e-system.windows.forms.t_64_2.vb)] [!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/e-system.windows.forms.t_64_2.cpp)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/e-system.windows.forms.t_64_2.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetRange (int minValue, int maxValue);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetRange(int32 minValue, int32 maxValue) cil managed

Docs.param: The lower limit of the range of the track bar.
The upper limit of the range of the track bar.
Docs.summary: Sets the minimum and maximum values for a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use this method to set the entire range for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> at the same time. To set the minimum or maximum values individually, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A> properties. If the `minValue` parameter is greater than the `maxValue` parameter, `maxValue` is set equal to `minValue`.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value added to or subtracted from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property when the scroll box is moved a small distance.
Docs.value: A numeric value. The default value is 1.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the user presses one of the arrow keys, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property changes according to the value set in the SmallChange property.
You might consider setting the value of SmallChange to a percentage of the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Height%2A> (for a vertically oriented track bar) or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Width%2A> (for a horizontally oriented track bar) property. This sets the distance your track bar moves proportionate to its size.
## Examples The following code example displays a form that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> control and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control. The example demonstrates setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.TickFrequency%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.LargeChange%2A>, and SmallChange properties and handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> contents are updated to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property value when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event occurs.
[!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.t_252_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.windows.forms.t_252_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.t_252_1.cs)]

Docs.value: The text associated with this control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is not relevant for this class.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Text%2A> property changes.
Gets or sets a value that specifies the delta between ticks drawn on the control.
Docs.value: The numeric value representing the delta between ticks. The default is 1.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> with a large range of values between the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum%2A> and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A> properties, it might be impractical to draw all the ticks for values on the control. For example, if you have a control with a range of 100, passing in a value of 5 here causes the control to draw 20 ticks. In this case, each tick represents five units in the range of values.
## Examples The following code example displays a form that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> control and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control. The example demonstrates setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A>, TickFrequency, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.LargeChange%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.SmallChange%2A> properties and handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> contents are updated to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property value when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event occurs.
[!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.t_209_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.windows.forms.t_209_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.t_209_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how to display the tick marks on the track bar.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the TickStyle property to modify the manner in which the tick marks are displayed on the track bar.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the TickStyle, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A> properties and how to handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.ValueChanged> event. To run the example, paste the following code into a form that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> control named `TrackBar1` and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control named `TextBox1`. Call the `InitializeTrackBar` method from the form's constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event-handling method.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.t_122_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.windows.forms.t_122_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.t_122_1.vb)]

Docs.exception: The assigned value is not a valid .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a string that represents the control.
Docs.returns: A string that represents the current .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ToString method returns a string that includes the type and the values for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> properties.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a numeric value that represents the current position of the scroll box on the track bar.
Docs.value: A numeric value that is within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A> range. The default value is 0.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Value property contains the number that represents the current position of the scroll box on the track bar.
## Examples The following code example displays a form that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> control and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control. The example demonstrates setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.TickFrequency%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.LargeChange%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.SmallChange%2A> properties and handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> contents are updated to the Value property value when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Scroll> event occurs.
[!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.t_37_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.windows.forms.t_37_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.t_37_1.cs)]

Docs.exception:
The assigned value is less than the value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum%2A>.
-or-
The assigned value is greater than the value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A>.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Value%2A> property of a track bar changes, either by movement of the scroll box or by manipulation in code.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use this event to update other controls when the value represented in the track bar changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.TickStyle%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Minimum%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar.Maximum%2A> members and how to handle the ValueChanged event. To run the example, paste the following code into a form that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TrackBar> control name `TrackBar1` and a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control named `TextBox1`. Call the `InitializeTrackBar` method from the form's constructor or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.Load> event-handling method.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/e-system.windows.forms.t_119_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/e-system.windows.forms.t_119_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.TrackBarExample#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/e-system.windows.forms.t_119_1.vb)]
